content.question: Using correct units, explain the meaning of the definite integral <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeWaaqWaaeaacaWG2bWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadsha aiaawIcacaGLPaaaaiaawEa7caGLiWoaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdae aapeGaaGinaiaaicdaa0Gaey4kIipakiaadsgacaWG0baaaa@4378@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> in the context of the problem. Approximate the value of <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <mrow> <msubsup> <mo>∫</mo> <mn>0</mn> <mrow> <mn>40</mn> </mrow> </msubsup> <mrow> <mrow> <mo>|</mo> <mrow> <mi>v</mi> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mi>t</mi> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <mo>|</mo> </mrow> </mrow> </mrow> </mstyle> <mi>d</mi> <mi>t</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+= feaagKart1ev2aaatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbuLwBLn hiov2DGi1BTfMBaeXatLxBI9gBaerbd9wDYLwzYbItLDharqqtubsr 4rNCHbGeaGqiVu0Je9sqqrpepC0xbbL8F4rqqrFfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9 vqaqpepm0xbba9pwe9Q8fs0=yqaqpepae9pg0FirpepeKkFr0xfr=x fr=xb9adbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaaeaaaaaaaaa8 qadaWdXaWdaeaapeWaaqWaaeaacaWG2bWaaeWaa8aabaWdbiaadsha aiaawIcacaGLPaaaaiaawEa7caGLiWoaaSWdaeaapeGaaGimaaWdae aapeGaaGinaiaaicdaa0Gaey4kIipakiaadsgacaWG0baaaa@4378@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> using a right Riemann sum with the four subintervals indicated in the table.

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
